message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS

This paper deals with topic modeling and measuring topical diversity of text documents, which are common topics in natural language processing and information retrieval. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a hierarchical re-estimation process for improving the quality of topic models, which involves machine learning techniques such as clustering and optimization, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also relevant sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with data analysis and evaluation, which are common topics in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
